page.title: 18Brighstone Forest
page.content: Approximately one third of the area of this block is covered by the {Brighstone Forest}which extends from east to west along the ridge of chalk hills collectively known as the{Downs. Planting began in 1919. The trees are mainly conifers with an area to the north of maturing beech. There are a few ash, sycamore and sweet chestnut. The{Forestry Commission}is responsible for the Brighstone Forest and controls both tree planting and felling. Much of the timber is used for fencing posts and pit props. Private individuals can buy a seasonal licence, presently #5.00 per annum, to collect fallen branches for firewood. A number of{bridleways}pass through the forest as does the {Tennyson Trail.}The public are welcome to use these for horse riding and walking.
